title: Jixian Wang: The Chinese vlogger broadcasting the Ukraine war
description: Based in Odesa, Jixian Wang hopes to show the reality of the Ukraine war to Chinese people.

title: Depp v Heard: What you might have missed this week
description: The court hears evidence of personality disorders, drug abuse and a relationship with Elon Musk.

title: Cast of Downton Abbey returns in new film
description: A mystery, a film crew and a trip to France are all part of Downton Abbey's second film outing.

title: The children surviving Ukraine’s war without their parents
description: Eleven-year-old Angelina is one of many children who were forced to flee hundreds of miles from their homes on Ukraine's front line.

title: Mysterious Zamestim artwork in St Petersburg signals Russia's anti-West defiance
description: While some Russians accept the Kremlin’s parallel reality on Ukraine, others take risks to protest.

title: Quiz of the week: What did Sir Lewis Hamilton win?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

title: Who owns the Arctic and should they drill for oil and gas?
description: Environmental campaigners are taking Norway to court over drilling in the Arctic.

title: Minority of men in politics behave like animals, says Suella Braverman
description: The attorney general says there are bad apples in Parliament, but problem starts in "wider society".

title: Manchester United fined after fans throw objects at Atletico Madrid's Diego Simeone
description: Manchester United are fined by Uefa after fans threw objects at Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone following their recent Champions League defeat.

title: Hakeem Hussain: Mum jailed over son's asthma attack death
description: Laura Heath had repurposed one of seven-year-old Hakeem Hussain's inhalers as a crack pipe.

title: German energy giant Uniper gives in to Russian rouble demand
description: Uniper is preparing to buy Russian gas using a payment system that critics say will undermine EU sanctions.

title: Ben Stokes: England name all-rounder as new Test captain to succeed Joe Root
description: All-rounder Ben Stokes is named as England Test captain, succeeding Joe Root who stepped down earlier this month.

title: 'Incredible' Serrano emerges from dim spotlight to seminal fight
description: BBC Sport profiles seven-weight world champion Amanda Serrano before her fight against Katie Taylor this weekend.

title: Netflix and Disney+ among streamers facing tighter regulation in UK
description: Netflix and other streaming services are to be regulated by Ofcom, under new government plans.

title: Jamie Wallis: Bridgend MP charged over car crash
description: Tory MP Jamie Wallis charged with failing to stop after a car crash in the Vale of Glamorgan.

title: MP Liam Byrne to be suspended from Commons for bullying former employee
description: The behaviour of Birmingham MP Liam Byrne was a "significant misuse of power", a report concludes.

title: Prima Facie: Critics praise Jodie Comer in her West End debut
description: The Killing Eve star appears in the play Prima Facie, which has sold out its two-month run.

title: Sirens ring out in Israel to honour Holocaust victims
description: Streets came to a standstill as people paused to pay tribute to the millions killed in the Holocaust.

title: Sainsbury's says shoppers are watching every penny
description: The supermarket's profits jump but it warns of tougher times ahead as consumers' finances are squeezed.

title: Samsung 2am running advert is 'not representing the truth' for women
description: Samsung's new advert has been criticised by some women's running groups for being unrealistic.

title: NI election 2022: SDLP hoping history repeats itself
description: The SDLP has a number of targets, but some of its existing seats are vulnerable to challengers.

title: War in Ukraine: Ukrainians deported to Russia beaten and mistreated
description: One man says he was captured and taken over the border, where he was blindfolded and beaten.

title: Olivia Wilde: Actress given custody papers on stage
description: Wilde was given a letter marked "private and confidential" on stage during a conference.

title: The Papers: Tory MP's 'porn shame' and 'fear of energy crisis'
description: Claims a senior MP was seen watching porn in the Commons and soaring gas prices in Europe lead the papers

title: Local elections: Children urge action to save wildlife
description: Children and young people press local election candidates for action on wildlife extinction.

title: 'Being spiked has stopped me from going out again'
description: Drink-spiking victims talk about its impact on them after MPs warn of the long-term consequences.

title: Climate change: Don't let doom win, project tells worriers
description: The BBC gets an exclusive look at a new project to help students deal with rising climate anxiety.

title: Why the West is reckoning with caste bias now
description: As caste discrimination gains visibility in the US, Indian-Americans grapple with their privilege.

title: The deadly accordion wars of Lesotho
description: Rivalry between stars of Famo, a popular style of music in Lesotho, has sparked years of gang warfare.
